Comes with roll-board, cards, and die.

20365.name: Corre, Yeti, corre
20365.description:
MAD-MAD, COMAN, BRUCE-LY and RANGO have to free the Yeti before the evil Dr. Bad sends it against a big city. They would have to find the combination of 10 metals that opens the 10 deadlocks that keep the Yeti captive.

This game is part of the CEFA 3D-games series.

20366.description:
The theme is troubles that girl students may experience.The players try to avoid these troubles.
This is a Japanese card game,and English rule include .
20366.name: Trouble School

20367.name: Boscaiola
20367.description:
The game consists of a plate, a set of small balls (5white and 1 red) and a spinning top (which comes in two pieces).
After putting the small balls in the plate, drive the top with your hand. the small balls will go into the seats.
When the top comes to a halt, sum up the numbers of the seats (holes) occupied by the small balls (if the red occupies a red seat it is worth twice as much).
If all the balls make points, one has the right to another go.
The player is disqualified if one ball or more fall out of the plate (into the corner pockets).
The winner is the player who is the first to make a number of points fixed in advance (for example 1000).
Several persons can play this game together.

20368.name: Cricket: Interactive Television Game
20368.description:
Players toss a coin, the winner having the choice of batting or fielding. Place the video cassette in player and press start/play and you will be in the thick of the action of World Cup Cricket.

The video contains 3 world cup matches and there's no need to rewind or pause the tape. the game consists of 72 consecutive games, totalling 72 hours of continuous play with each game having a different result.
Once you press play the battle commences, and the batting team strives to obtain the highest number of runs while the fielding team endeavours to take all their wickets before the end of the innings and so restricting the number of runs.
The winner of the game is the team with the highest run total after both innings have been played.

20369.name: Alphabet Lotto: Farmyard Tales Games
20369.description:
From the box:
Your Child will have fun and learn valuable pre-reading skills, such as word and picture matching, with Poppy & Sam and the animals from Farmyard Tales.

Developed with the Child Development Unit at Nottingham University.

20370.description:
"Liberate Lutetia and the other Gaulish towns from the Roman cohorts."

Le tour de Gaule d'Astérix is a simple roll the die and move game, in which players attempt to liberate towns as they move through Gaul.

The board consists of a round track superimposed on a map of Gaul. Lutetia and 19 other Gaulish towns are located at various spaces on the track. Each player starts with some money which they may use for equipping Gaulish armies. In turn, each player rolls the die and moves the indicated number of spaces along the circular track. If a player lands on an unliberated town, he or she may attempt to liberate it using their Gaulish armies.
20370.name: Le tour de Gaule d'Astérix

20371.description:
Astérix et la potion magique is a simple game in which players traverse Europe looking for ingredients for the magic potion.

At the start of the game each player chooses a personality and is given a gourd of magic potion by Getafix. On his or her turn a player moves one space in the direction of their choice. If the space contains a roman patrol then the player must take a swig of magic potion. Green and blue spaces enable the player to take an event card. Ingredients may be collected by landing on a town. The first player to collect all the ingredients in their cauldron and return to the village wins the game.
20371.name: Astérix et la potion magique

20372.name: Gemstones
20372.description:
From an 1989 Mayfair catalog:
Diamonds, rubies, amber, emeralds, sapphires; the playthings of kings inspire this exciting dice game. Includes dice and rules for play.

This looks like ordinary RPG dice, but there is a real game in there.

20373.name: Trepido
20373.description: Card version of scissors rock paper including a color tie breaker of red orange green. Looks like a get rid of your cards first Uno style by topping the previous card.

20375.name: Roonic
20375.description:
Each of 52 cards has two letters (AB,CD, etc.) on it and there are four of each denomination. Deal out all cards and the dealer calls a trump word. For example, PIG. This means the OP is the highest denomination, IJ is next and GH is next. Otherwise, AB is higher than CD, etc.

Points are scored for capturing cards, with bonus points for trump and more bonus points if syllables of and/or the entire trump word can be spelled with captured cards.

20376.name: Word Rummy
20376.description:
An early game of rummy with words. The deck has 78 letter cards -- the entire alphabet in each color (red, green, & blue). Each letter has a point value from 1 to 5, commoner letters with higher values. Deal 7 cards each for 6 or less players, 6 each for 7 players, 5 for 8 players, and turn up the top of the draw pile to start the discard pile.

In a turn of the Standard game, a player draws 1 from either pile, plays words to the table, and discards 1. Each word must have at least 2 letters, and all must be of the same color, unless it has more than 1 of a certain letter. If the word has more than one repeated letter (e.g. "refer") the second 'e' and 'r' most both be of the same color. Words on the table may not be added to or otherwise changed.

The hand ends when a player empties his hand, or when the draw pile runs out. Each player scores: for words on the table, the length of the word squared (e.g. 5 letters => 25 points); for words in the hand, the simple length of the word (5 letters => 5 points); and for each card in hand, the value of the card is subtracted. The game is won at 150 points.

The Advanced game has a yahtzee-like scoring pad. There is a row for each word length from 2 to 8, and two scoring columns. The first word scored for each length is written in the Primary column; and further words for that length are simply tallied in the Secondary column. After a chosen length of time or number of hands, the player with the highest Primary total wins; ties are broken by the Secondary total.

Finally, the Inverse game only scores penalties: at the end of the hand, players total the points left in their hands. After a chosen number of deals, the lowest score wins.

20377.name: Flair
20377.description:
From the rules:
Flair is played with standard card decks and any number from two to six can play. Combining the elements of science, strategy and bluff, Flair is designed to keep combatants at wit's edge. The game is played with two trump suits, wild cards, an a scoreboard. The first half of each hand, called the buildup, is pure cutthroat. The second half, a playoff called the tally, will give you an opportunity to express your best card skill.

OBJECT OF PLAY
During the first half of the game, the buildup, the object is to build combinations of cards, popularly referred to as melds, and strengthen one's hand for the secong half, the tally, when players establish trumps, and tricks count for the score. Tricks do not count in the buildup half. They only determine which cards are drawn from the token and stock piles.

20378.name: TAG, The Transactional Awareness Game
20378.description: The childhood game of tag us based on making contact. So is TAG. More than an exciting game based on Transactional Awareness, TAG is a revelation of the constant interplay of human interaction at all levels and movements. Accepting acknowledged insights into the nature of interpersonal behavior, TAG identifies and summarizes the 16 basic interactional styles, from the authoritarian "Director" to the acquiescent "Follower" to the headstrong "Individualist". By understanding how every person's own style interacts with the style of others, the player can better understand the roots of empathy or antagonism experienced in relationships. Through TAG, the player discovers more complementary transactions and avoids stifling ploys and fruitless struggles. Beyond discussing the dynamics of relationships, TAG provides ethical norms for transactions designed to equalize and bring them to greater fulfillment.

20379.name: Statis-Pro Baseball Great Teams
20379.description:
Statis-Pro Baseball Great Teams serves as a stand-alone game as well as an add-on to the excellent baseball simulation series.

Included in the bookshelf box:

(1) Gameboard
(1) Rules
(1) Scorepad
(1) Set, fast-action cards [98 cards]
(1) Set, player cards
(4) Out charts
(3) Pawns for baserunners

The player cards included in the set were for the following teams:

'62 Dodgers '69 Orioles
'84 Tigers '65 Twins
'76 Phillies '61 Yankees
'75 A's '86 Mets
'75 Reds '62 Giants

20380.name: Scooby-doo! Cyber Chase
20380.description:
From Publisher:

"Scooby Doo and his friends have been zapped into a computer game and a most hair-raising adventure is about to begin: the Cyber Chase!

Start off in the Science Lab and on your turn spin to see what will happen next. On your way, you need to overcome three different challenges. The Roman Coliseum, with its hungry lions, presents the first challenge. A prehistoric jungle filled with dinosaurs is the second and a Samurai warrior is the third. By winning the three challenges, you'll collect the three snacks that you need: a steak, a bone and an apple.

Along the way the Phantom Virus will try to set you back. So choose your friend: Scooby Doo, Shaggy, Velma, Daphne or Fred and let the adventure begin."

20381.name: Auction
20381.description: Not to be confused with the 3M/AH game "Auction". Cheap looking, low budget bookshelf game of bidding and buying (as it says on the box). Very similar in mechanic and feel to 3M's Auction, though I'm not sure which came first.

20382.name: The Hummingbird Game
20382.description:
From rules:
Object of the Game: To develop bird "nests" (or sets) made up of a Bird card, a Range card for that Bird card, and a Flower card. A nest may also have a Feathered Fact card (for that Bird card) and an Insect card.

In order to develop bird nests, each player adds to her/his supply by leading on her/his turn, a card upon which the others will play a card. Usually the lead card will take the trick (a trick is all the cards played, one from each player), but watch out! Every kind of card when led, can be taken by some other card. See the PECKING ORDER. Tricks taken are put in the hand to be used for making nests or for further play.

20383.name: Tug of War
20383.description: Both players play from identical decks and try to build two monsters pulling the rope (on the plastic mat), before being forced to build the third color monster. Winner is the player to build two monsters pulling or having the opponent build his "you lose" monster.

20384.name: Doublecross
20384.description:
From box:
Doublecross, with its unique three-sectioned domino, provides an intriguing change of pace for the avid board game player, yet offers new avenues of play for veteran domino lovers.

20386.name: Bambi
20386.description:
Players turn over number cards, highest gets to steal letter from another player. Try to collect letters that spell Bambi.

Cards are divided into numbers and letters. There's four cards for each letter in Bambi's name. All letter cards feature a picture of Bambi. There are four copies of each number card.


1 features Flower
2 features Chipmunk
3 features Squirrel
4 features Thumper
5 features Birds
6 features Owl
7 features Bambi's Mother.


Players select cards to spell Bambi. Number cards are dealt out face down equally to all players. Each player then turns over the top number card. The player with the highest number steals a card from another player. The round is over when all number cards have been turned over. Players are out when they have no letter cards left. Players score an increasing number of points for each Bambi they can spell with their letter cards. Play continues until someone reaches 100 points.

All illustrations are copyrighted W.D.P. [Walt Disney Pictures]

This is Volume 4 of a 6 Volume Disney Set of Card Games.

20387.name: Zoo Mania
20387.description: Try to get rid of your cards and trap your opponents with as many cards as possible.

20388.name: Hide n' Seek
20388.description:
Trying to recall this from memory, as it's been close to 30 years since I last played this one.

Hide n' Seek is a childrens game. For those days when you couldn't play outside, and playing the real thing inside would have driven mom nuts.

One player is "it". The other players put their pawns under any of the 9 hiding locations, and up to two players can hide in any one location.

"It" rolls the die and moves toward one of the the hiding places. Some of the hiding places are alone on paths, some are located on paths that diverge to more than one hiding space, and of course there are near and far spaces to hide.

After "It" moves, the other players can decide to make a break for it, trying to reach home before "It" can catch them.

20389.name: Zombie Plague: Canisters
20389.description:
This expansion introduces Trioxin canisters into Zombie Plague. "Misplaced" by the military, these objects may prove to be the source of the plague... or they may just bring further complications to it.

Expands:

Zombie Plague

20392.description:
Players attempt to hang their monkeys from the tree as carefully as possible without causing it to collapse. The first player to successfully hang all of his monkeys is the winner. If the tree collapses the game is over and the players start again. This game contains rules for three different variations of the game: 1. Turn based with the use of a positive/negative numbered die, 2. Time based where all players move at the same time, 3. Team based where you can only hang your monkeys off of your teammate's monkeys. For ages 3 and up.

Similar to:

Monkey Business
Monkeying Around
20392.name: Hanging Monkies

20393.description:
From the box:

Self-correcting Adding Fun--Thomas the Tank Engine rolls down the tracks bringing an exciting new numbers game for children. Come and play with Thomas and his friends. You'll learn your numbers and how to add them, too!

To Play: Spin the spinner to choose the numbered pieces that fit in your train. When the train is completed, the pieces add up to the number on the end of the car. Verying levels of play make the game fun for beginning and advance players.

Skill for Young Players: Beginners can play by recognizing and matching numbers. Advanced players will understand that various combinations can be used to add up to the number on the end of the car. All players learn important social skills: taking turns, sharing and respecting others.

Contents:

4 Playing boards
24 Number pieces
1 Spinner
20393.name: Thomas the Tank Engine:  Thomas Numbers Game

20394.name: Max Steel
20394.description: A boardgame based on the Max Steel property. Released only in Latin America.

20395.name: Barbie and the Magic of Pegasus
20395.description:
A boardgame based on the Barbie movie Barbie and the Magic of Pegasus.

From the publisher: Help Annika and her sister, Brietta, break the evil wizard's spell that turned Brietta into a Pegasus and their family into stone! Race to collect the 3 items needed to build the Wand of light,then be the first to arrive back at the castle to rescue the royal family.

20396.name: Armored Trooper Votoms: Conflict on Kummen
20396.description:
Based on the "Armored Trooper Votoms" mecha anime sci-fi series, "Conflict on Kummen" is a boardgame about piloted robot fighting machines. "Conflict on Kummen" is a one page, free, promotional game printed on glossy perforated card stock. Apparently the game is a tie-in to a roleplaying game, and a related series of boardgames (though it's not clear if the board games were published).

Components include a map and small cut-out counters and range/distance gauge all on glossy cardstock. The rules, mecha stats are on the back along with a postcard. (If you mail the postcard, you will lose half the board.) The board has no grid or hexes, so the game has a miniatures flavor. Rules are very short and simple with turn order being determined each phase by rolling and adding a mental stat. Mechs move and fight with ranged weapons, until losing all their hit points.

20397.name: The Champagne Game
20397.description:
A Game of LIFE, LOVE, ROMANCE and CHAMPAGNE!!!

A romantic game for two, where you learn more about your partner... and even more about your self!

The board is 48 pieces which when put together form the shape of a champagne bottle. "Champagne" pieces run down the centre and each time you remove on of these, you drink champagne! But pieces to the left and right must first be removed to release the "Champagne" tiles and these can only be removed by players appropriate responses to the instructions on the cards. On the basis of TRUTH, CORRECTNESS and SATISFACTION. Your responses will be assessed by your partner. Play continues from the "cork" to the "bottle".

Players may be asked to:

Answer questions,
Give an opinion,
Discuss their inner feelings,
Perform small acts of love,
Examine their likes and dislikes,
Drink Champagne
and more....

This game is a powerful recipe for a romantic makeover, guaranteed to keep that spark glowing bright....

20398.name: Blow Your Nose
20398.description: "Instant fun game which can be played at home, in the bar, in the office - anywhere" This addictive, cult game, originally designed for children but quickly hi-jacked by adult game fanatics as a table-top, bar and party game, is now available with DRINKING RULES. The game is simply played by blowing your 'noses' through a series of numbered hoops, the rules being similar to the game of croquet, but it is not as easy as it seems.

20399.name: Wine Knot
20399.description:
A very old nautical drinking game, playable in 8 x variations. The games in 'Wine Knot' are variations of old nautical drinking games, believed to have been originated by Portuguese sailors involved in the notorious 'triangular trade' of the 18th century where wine and textiles were shipped to Africa, traded for slaves who were then shipped to the Americas, the ships returning to Europe with cargoes of molasses and tobacco. Long periods at sea and wine in abundance, diversions were created using the materials at hand; wood, canvas and rope.

There are eight games to be played, which will provide interesting, unusual and amusing entertainment for up 8 players for as many hours as you wish.
Port wine was originally used but because of its strength an ordinary (or extraordinary) bottle of red or white wine will ensure that the game does not finish too early.

20400.name: Sex, Booze & Rock n Roll
20400.description: "A Fun Packed Evening of Entertainment!" As you move around the board you will answer trivia questions on the subjects of SEX, BOOZE and ROCK 'N' ROLL. This game is a treat for trivia fans, but there is an extra dimension where players, on certain squares, have to do more than answer questions....You may have to name 10 words relating to sex, beginning with the first letter of your surname, drink a full glass of whatever the person to your right is drinking, or maybe hum the intro to "Smoke on the water"

20401.name: Steamy Scenes
20401.description: Players (couples selected at random) act out "steamy scenes" from well known movies, for the audience to guess" A sexier version of "charades" combined with "amorous amateur dramatics" could describe this fun game which will bring out the ACTOR WITHIN. It provides the opportunity to bring a semblance of professional detachment to a scene that some would find sensual, arousing or downright embarrassing. The two acting partners selected at random have 3 minutes to convince the audience of the title of a movie, playing in silence the scene(s) as described in detail on the card. A further 3 minutes is allowed for "charades" type play if the acting is not up to it.

20402.name: Postmans' Promise
20402.description:
"A very sexy party game for 4 - 24 players"Fate decides WHO does WHAT, WHERE and with WHOM. A sexy game of chance, based loosely on the old favorite Postman's Knock. You may have to "squeeze and kiss passionately" for "2 minutes" in the "bathroom, in the shower (water optional) - lights off" with mystery person "number 9".

This game is not "X" rated but should only be played by broad minded people as a degree of intimacy is required.

20403.name: Tarts & Vicars
20403.description: As well as being a fun game and a sexy game this is also a drinking game. The object of the game is simply to get to Heaven (when the required numbers of Halos have been acquired.) You must avoid the Deadly sins and other temptations along the way, and in particular, avoid going to jail and/ or taking the Slippery Slope to Hell.

20404.name: Gayopoly
20404.description:
A gay-themed Monopoly variant. From the website (www.slypussproductions.com):

"Play the ultimate tourist and own a gay monopoly! We're queer, we're here, we're everywhere! The game for today! We're running for office, we're parents, we're business owners. All this, while going to the gym, maxing out our credit cards, singingn too loud while driving our car and using our cell phone!

48 different businesses to visit! Spend money, or make money. Play the ultimate tourist and become the 'Queen of the Universe.'

The ultimate in role playing - 6 different characters to play: Ivana Munch, Freeda Knight, Jim Freak, Amanda Bee, Ian D. Middel, Lou Cinda Booty.

In order to get 'Out Of The Closet' all you have to do is sing. Over 50 of your all-time ultimate divas in the deck. Your favorite songstresses of yesterday, today and tomorrow.

Contents: 2-sided boardgame, 6 cell phone game pieces, 2 rainbow colored dice, 1 sandtimer, 1 plastic tray (holds 600 Queer Cards), 76 Diva Detour cards, 72 Whatever cards, 48 title cards, 48 employee cards, 48 supervisor cards, 48 manager cards."

20405.name: Words
20405.description: A Canadian variation of the free game Dictionary, more popularly marketed as Balderdash. "Words" has cards with real words and their definitions, which must be read by one player. Other players must try to guess the meaning, or else make up a plausible-sounding definition, after which all players vote on which definition they believe is the correct one. This Canadian edition was published in 1983 and comes with a large box of word cards with definitions.

20406.description:
Eagles of the Gulf !, part I was published in Battleplan #9, as an expansion to the Air Superiority line from GDW.

The material was the ground support companion to the Desert Falcons expansion. The introduction notes that to play this expansion requires owning Air Superiority, Air Strike and Desert Falcons, making it risky to publish as a regular module. So the magazine format was chosen to publish the material. The material was to be published in two installments. Unfortunately, Battleplan,No.9 turned out to be the last issue so part II was made available in two parts in issues 11 and 12 of Air Power, a newsletter published by J. D. Webster and Tony Valle.
20406.name: Eagles of the Gulf!

20407.name: Premium: The Insurance Game
20407.description: In Premium, a single pawn is moved around the board. When it lands on an unowned property, the moving player may purchase it and may also insure it for 50% or 100% of its value. After the first circuit of the board, players draw cards on every turn which may cause damage to the property landed on or specific named properties - the owners get paid if they have insurance policies but lose the properties without compensation if they do not. At the start of each circuit players collect income from every other player for each property they own. The object is to be the last player with money.

20408.name: Sam's Hooligan
20408.description:
From the rulebook: "A dice game to please everyone; the crapshooter, the cardplayer...even ardent gamblers. Sam's Hooligan has the excitement of a crap game and the tension of poker, combined with a scoring system that changes the odds with each roll of the dice."

"Sam's Hooligan is a dice game with terrific action and changing odds. It's a challenging game developed during the 30's by a disreputable crapshooter from Chicago."

This is another variation of the traditional game Yacht (like Yahtzee and Yum) but this uses 2-color card images on the dice, adds flushes as possible "hands", lowers the value of a hand for each re-roll you use, and includes 2 jokers on the dice.

20409.description: Just the same game as History of War, but with new cards from Japan vs. USA
20409.name: History of War: Pacific Edition

20411.name: Color Cubes
20411.description: Game consists of a 5x5 3d grid and contains 25 "cubes" with different colors on each side. Sitting across from the other player you must play cubes one at a time until one player gets five different colors in a row either verticall, horizontally or diagonally. The "cubes" have differnt colors on each side, so when playing a color on your side you play another color on the opponents side.

20412.name: Excuses
20412.description:
Excuses is the hilarious card game that's packed with the wackiest excuses ever. Some are believable and some will only get you into hot water. Each player has to play his best excuse according to the situation card to collect as many tricks as possible and win the game.
The group votes on whose excuse is the best eg funniest or most believable or whatever.

20414.name: RPGQuest: Greek Mythology
20414.description:
A very colorful mixture of RPG and Boardgame, this brazilian game is designed for children of ages 8-10 as an introduction to miniature games.

The game has rules for miniature battles between two or more participants. As in most miniatures games, players build an army with the same number of recruiment points (with each miniature having a different point value), then take turns moving and attacking until the opponent's forces are dead, withdrawn, or your pre-determined time limit expires.

The basic game has 7 races and 8 classes to choose from, over 80 paper fold-out miniatures, 2 82x55cm colored maps and dozens of props.

20415.name: Hallmark Celebrations!
20415.description: This is a trivia game that challenges your ability to remember the special occasions that other players share with you. You'll also be quizzed in birthday and holiday trivia. Answering questions correctly scores points. The player with the most points at the end is the winner.

20416.name: Holiday Shuffle
20416.description:
From the box:

Bet you didn't know that Sibling Appreciation Day was in the same month as Mother's Day. And National Relaxation Day is the day before Joke Day, with Watermelon Day two days after. In this game of fun days and holidays you must take the dates you're dealt and rearrange them in chronological order. So plan your strategy and pick your day. You may even find a new holiday as you play.

20417.name: Professor Noggin's Life in the Ocean
20417.description: Part of Profesor Noggin's series of educational games to teach kids about their favorite subjects. The game contains 30 cards, each card has six questions, three easy and three hard. Players roll a special three-numbered die to select questions. The fronts of the cards feature colorful pictures of sea life.

20419.description: In this version of Monopoly Junior players assume the roles of Disney princesses. Choose from Ariel, Pocahontas, Snow White, Belle, Cinderella, Jasmine, Sleeping Beauty, and Mulan. Buy a home, build a castle on it and charge the other players rent to land there. Be be careful not to run into Maleficent or Ursula, or you'll have to pay! Collect the most money by the end of the game to win.
20419.name: Monopoly Junior: Disney Princess

20420.description: This version of Trivial Pursuit for kids challenges your knowledge of the Nickelodeon cable channel. How much do you know about Nickelodeon live-action shows or favorites like SpongeBob SquarePants, Jimmy Neutron, and The Fairly OddParents? The game includes four decorative tokens and 1200 Nicksclusive questions.
20420.name: Trivial Pursuit for Kids: Nick Edition

20421.name: Cat 'N Mouse
20421.description: This children's dexterity game features a moving carousel shaped like a circular clothesline. Plastic mice are placed around the rim of the circle. Each player has a lever with a plastic cat on it. Pressing the lever launches the cat upwards and (hopefully) knocks a mouse off the carousel. The player that has caught the most mice when time runs out is the winner.

20422.name: Beat the Parents
20422.description:
From the box:

Test your knowledge of the opposite generation with a series of funny questions as you make your way across the board. Parents are asked questions most kids can answer and the kids are asked questions most parents can answer, but watch out for those wild cards that could send you reeling back or skipping ahead to the finish. The first player or team to cross the board with all of their tokens wins the game and the battle.

20423.name: Sesame Street Cookie Hunt
20423.description:
Sesame Street Cookie Hunt is a card game for ages 4 and up. The deck consists of several pairs of cards, and a unique Cookie Card. The cards are shuffled and dealt out to the players, who take turns drafting a card from the player to the left. Pairs are removed from play. The goal is to obtain and keep the Cookie Card. When all the pairs have been eliminated, the person holding the Cookie Card is the winner.

Me want cookies!!!

20424.name: Pilgrim's Progress
20424.description:
PILGRIM'S PROGRESS has a similar theme and name to another entry on the database but is an entirely different game.

From the box:

"The PILGRIM'S PROGRESS board game faithfully recreates the wealth of atmosphere from Bunyan's classic all time best seller. In your progress to the Celestial City from the City of Destruction, you may meet any of the Characters just as Christian did. The progress you make along the route takes you through the Slough of Despond, you may stay at Palace Beautiful, encounter the dangers of meeting Apollyon in the Valley of the Shadow or get captured and taken off to Doubting Castle.

You must plan, pray and prepare for each encounter, for only your prayer and determination protect and spur you on.

All together PILGRIM'S PROGRESS creates an exciting and totally absorbing game within an authentic and informative format that will excite all ages and provide a wonderful teaching aid whilst being tremendous fun to play."

20425.name: The Big Breakfast Game
20425.description:
THE BIG BREAKFAST GAME is a 60 or 90 minute (dependant on the number of players) themed on the UK Channel 4 TV Series The Big Breakfast.

The board is divided into 8 areas which are visited by the players based on spinning the spinner. On arriving at the designated area players have to complete an activity in a manner similar to the items featured on the TV show:

SNAP CACKLE POP - A memory game in which players have 30 seconds to memorise 14 items on a list and a further 30 seconds to recall them.

WHOSE WASHING LINE - The player has to guess the identity of someone from clues read from a card.

ON THE BED - A player must convey the identity of someone to the other players without using any of the words written on the card.

ONE LUMP OR TWO - A drawing game in which players try to reproduce the picture on a card with their eyes shut.

THE CRUNCH - Players perform silly actions as described on a card.

DOWN YOUR DOORSTEP - Players must guess where they are from the description on the card.

EGG ON YOUR FACE - Players must mime or impersonate the individual on the card for 30 seconds.

INVENTION CORNER - Players must attempt to answer general knowledge questions.

Points, in the form of breakfast items (sausage, tea, marmalade, egg, toast ...) are awarded for succesful completion of activities. After a predetermined time (60 minutes for 4 or less players, 90 for 5 or 6 players) the game ends. The winner is the player with the biggest breakfast (i.e. the one with the greatest number of points).

20426.description: Triangular backgammon for three players (with a variant for two). During the game, one player with three or more pieces out of play can became "the killer", with special rules.
20426.name: Top: 3

20427.name: Ferienspiel Jungfrauregion
20427.description:
FERIENSPIEL JUNGFRAUREGION is a Swiss game that has more than a little of Monopoly about it.

Players progress around the board according to die rolls. When landing on property squares players hae the option of electing to purchase them from the bank, though larger properties cannot be purchased until the three smaller properties in the same set (of four) have been sold. As in Monopoly other players landing on property that you own have to pay a charge.

Random elements are thrown in through squirrel and clover cards which are generally of the go to..., pay the bank..., get from the bank... type.

2,000 Fr are received for passing through square 70 (not START), but the principle is the same.

There are no houses or hotels to buy, but fimilair rules for mortgages, credit and bankrupcy apply.

The winner is the player, who after two hours (or other pre-determined limit) has the most money (cash and property less bank loans).

20428.name: Justice League Unlimited Champion Checkers
20428.description:
This is the game of checkers with superheroic powers. Each side has 7 superheroes among their checkers: Superman, Wonder Woman, Batman, Hawkgirl, Green Lantern, Martian Manhunter, and The Flash.

There are 3 variants descibing how to use these powers: one has them activating powers once they are kinged, another has the superheroes open to both players, and the last has all the checkers shielded, like in Stratego so you don't know which of your opponents' checkers is which.

20429.description:
Supercharge is one of the four Folio games included in North Africa Quad, but also sold separately.

Supercharge covers several battles around El Alamein in North Africa in 1942. In fact there are three scenarios:


1. Battle of Alam Halfa: A short offensive by the Afrika Korps attempting to push east (8 game turns).
2. Battle of El Alamein: The first British attack on the German line near El Alamein (15 turns).
3. Operation Supercharge: The big offensive that brokethrough the German lines and routed the Africa Korps (7 turns).


The components consist of the following: a 'Standard' Rules fold-out 'sheet'(about 3-Full pages) for the game series; an 'Exclusive' Rules sheet(1-page); a 4-COLOR paper Mapsheet-(17" by 22"); a set of cardboard counters(around 120). Players must provide their OWN 6-sided DIE prior to play.

On the Mapsheet are the Turn Record Track, a Terrain Key, and the set-up locations for the Units of both the 'Campaign' & 'Sidi Rezegh' games. Overall, the COLOR of the Mapsheet is WHITE with BLUE-(Water/Sea, Allied 'Fortified Box', Minefield Hex-sides), BROWN-(Rough), Light GRAY-(Broken), & Dark BROWN-(Roads, Trails). The Area encompassed by this Mapsheet is the coastal road and areas south centered on El Alamein, and Alam Halfa Ridge.

The game counters are TAN-with BLACK print for Germans, TAN-with GREEN print for Italians, GREEN with BLACK print for British. Game scale is given as 1.7 Miles across each hex, each Turn represents 1-Day, and Units range in size from Battalion up to Brigade level.

One unique thing of Supercharge is that the supply rules in the standard rules game are ignored completely.
20429.name: Supercharge

20430.name: Linx Game
20430.description:
From the website:

LINX™ is a word game for people who love playing with words. There are over 3,500 four letter words in the English language, and we have invented a NEW WORD GAME called LINX™ using just four letter words. LINX™ is quick to learn, easy to play but fiendish to master. A game can take five minutes, or one can play for a whole evening.

You can play LINX™ by yourself as well as with one or more friends. It is suitable for players aged over 12yrs and over.

You can read more about this game at www.ThinkingGames.com

20431.description:
A fast soccer game in that the players play the Ball through solving of multiplication tasks. The various Numbers on the Gameboard are interchangeable, so every Match is a different challenge.
( Please excuse my bad english )
20431.name: Die Wilden Fussballkerle: Tooor! Das wilde Fussballspiel

20432.description:
Starfire 3rd Edition was a complete redesign of the classic Starfire. This was the third major edition in the Starfire series. Major revisions in the combat system resolves many of the issues with the original game, and included using a 1d10 dice roll system rather than 2d6.

The ship design system remained the heart of the game, allowing players to design their own starships, and then engaging in battle against their opponents. A variety of systems, at different levels of technolgoy, allow for varying strategies and tactics.

In 1997, Task Force Games, sold the Starfire game system to Starfire Design Studio, and they released electronic supplements for Starfire 3rd Edition. In 1998 Starfire Design Studio released the Starfire 3rd Edition Revised Rulebook.

Re-implements:

Starfire
boardgameversion: Starfire Design Studio Revised Rulebook edition 1998
20432.name: Starfire (3rd Edition)

20433.name: Where In The World is Carmen Sandiego? Card Game
20433.description:
Object: Track Carmen and her gang by correctly identifying well-known people, places, and things.
Contains: 28 trivia cards, which can be reversed to make a puzzle of a world map.
Rules:
1. The first player becomes the Reader, and takes a card from the deck.
2. The player on the Reader's left chooses a number between 1 and 20, and the Reader reads that clue. The player guesses the secret identity, and receives the card if correct. If incorrect, the Reader reads another clue to the next player. Play continues in a clockwise direction until someone guesses the secret identity and wins the card.
3. The player on the Reader's left becomes the next Reader, and selects a new card from the deck.
4. The first player to collect five cards catches Carmen Sandiego and wins the game!

20435.description:
Forces of Darkness is an expansion in the Dungeon Twister series of games.

With Powers of Darkness discover 8 new characters, 7 objects (from which to select 6), and 8 new rooms and all the rules which relate to them. This expansion contains all the material necessary for a game for 2 players except for the basic rules, the charts of combat, and the folding screens. It can also be combined with the base game and other expansions.

You will be able to work out new tactics and strategies centered on the exploitation of the casualties. Dark death and arts will not have any more secrets for you.

A new type of terrain based upon the darkness will enable you to discover a new and innovative mechanism using new material elements. Without the torches, equipment essential to any adventurer who respects himself, you will not be able to be enter the oppressive darkness. Many other elements of terrain will come to enrich your party and could also be used to create your own original scenarios.

New creatures include:

The Vampire(4/2): Undead. His combat value increase each time he kills an opponent. Can change to an undead bat with (6/0)
The Mummy(3/4): Undead. Break porticullis. Strong and not too slow, but he has a flaw: if all adjacent oponnent in a fight has a torch, the mummy's owner is forced to play his 0-card.
The Ghoul(6/2): Undead. He can carry the opponent's wounded character. If he exits the dungeon with any wounded character, he gets an extra Victory Point.
The Undead Dragon(2/6): Undead. Can regenerate just like the troll. Gives two victory points to the player killing it.
The Necromancer(4/2): Magic User. For one action point, he can transform an adjacent wounded character, even the opponent, into a zombie(3/2, undead). Can raise a zombie from a grave (special terrain type).
The Angel of Light(5/1): Can light the darkness as if she was carrying a torch, using her magic ability.
The Shadow(4/2): Undead. Can act in the darkness as if it was a normal terrain type.
The Specter(4/0): Undead. Can move through any terrain type. Gives no point if it exits the dungeon. Can resurrect into an opponent wounded character. The specter "die". The wounded character is considered fully healed and is now in control of the player who owned the specter.

Expands

Dungeon Twister
20435.name: Dungeon Twister: Forces of Darkness
boardgameaccessory: Dungeon Twister Forces of Darkness Miniatures

20436.description:
Stonehenge is an anthology board game, a new concept where five award-winning game designers, all using the same gaming components, create five very different games in one box. The ancient ruin of Stonehenge will never be the same. The five games are:

a magic game by Richard Garfield (Magic: The Gathering, RoboRally, The Great Dalmuti)
a political game by Bruno Faidutti (Mystery of the Abbey, Citadels, Knightmare Chess)
a battle game by Richard Borg (Battle Cry, Liar's Dice, Memoir '44)
an auction game by James Ernest (Kill Dr. Lucky, Diceland, Pirates of the Spanish Main)
a science-fiction game by Mike Selinker (Risk Godstorm, Pirates, Axis & Allies Revised)




From racing through the ruins to auctioning them off, these five games and other new games designed for it, will keep Stonehenge fresh for years to come.

Rules for additional Stonehenge games can be found at the http://paizo.com/paizoGames/library.
20436.name: Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Spiel #46 - Stoned

boardgamehonor: 2010 Origins Awards Best Board Game Nominee
2011 Juego del Año Tico Nominee
20437.description:
You and your opponents represent powerful developers in a burgeoning Nevada city. You will earn money and prestige by building the biggest and most profitable casinos on "The Strip," the town's backbone of dust and sin. You start with nothing but parking lots and dreams, but from there you build, sprawl, reorganize and gamble your way to victory. Score the most points investing in the most profitable development companies and putting the best bosses in control of the richest casinos. Put your dollars on the line . . . it's time to roll!

The game board is broken into 8 different areas, each consisting of a number of empty 'lots'. Players build lots by paying money and placing a die of the value matching the one shown on the lot's space onto the lot, along with a casino tile of one of 7 colors. Adjoining lots of the same color are considered a single casino. The casino's boss is the player whose die value is higher than any other in the casino. On each players turn, players turn over a new card representing a new lot they get. The card also is one of the casino colors. Any built casinos of the matching color will score both money and VP. Money is earned for each lot in the casino, where each lot may be owned by a different player. VP goes only to the casino's owner. Players can expand their casinos; try to take over casinos owned by other players; make deals to trade lots, casinos and money; or gamble in opponents' casinos to make more money. Ultimately, though, only victory points matter, and that means making yourself boss of the biggest casinos.

Lords of Vegas contains:

Snazzy game board
4 turn summaries
55 cards
40 chips in 4 colors
48 dice in 4 colors
4 poker chips
Lots of money
45 casino blocks
Rules
20437.name: Lords of Vegas
boardgameexpansion: Lords of Vegas: Mob Rules & Union of the Shakes
Lords of Vegas: Sky Bridge / Building Boom
Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #13
Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #7
boardgamepodcastepisode: #103 – Extra Life Recap & Codenames
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 019 – 10 Reasons to Buy a Game
Dukes of Dice Podcast - Ep. 03 - Legitimate Businessmen
Episode 002
Episode 11: The Lone Shark
Episode 13 - The Vault
Episode 26 - Lords of Tamriel
Episode 26: Star Wars Rebellion Review - Brawlers Maul
Episode 4 - More Than Two Need Not Apply
Episode 5: Mice & Mystics, Escape from New York, and Lords of Waterdeep
Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
Episode 73 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 2
Lords of Vegas
Lords of Vegas
Lords of Vegas Showdown
Podcast #18: The Turbocast
Strange Assembly 135 - An Ornamental Arrangement, Part 1
The Dice Steeple Episode #14 Is Luck Really Luck?
The Good, The Board, and the Trying to Be Consistant:  Episode 27 “Heavy Games”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 70!!

20438.name: Bee Lines
20438.description:
A children's game, involving adding and subtracting 2 numbers, rolled on two spinners, from 1-10.

Players take turn to flick the two spinners, producing two numbers. The player can the place a bee on the sum of the numbers (adding), or the difference of the numbers (subtracting the low number from the high). In the case of a double, the player gets an extra turn.

The board is filled with numbers from 0 to 20, and the first player to make a complete line from one side to the other has won the game.

Since some numbers are harder to come by than others, there is some skill in choosing the right path. There is also some skill in using numbers that can potentially give you more than one way to continue, as well as blocking your opponents path.

20440.name: Saxum
20440.description:
A rather straightforward dice game by Sid Sackson. Players alternate rolling two dice and allocating markers onto a 5 x 5 grid at the coordinates corresponding to the numbers thrown. If a six comes up, it can be counted as any other number by sacrificing six points from the acting player's score, or else simply re-rolled. Players are allowed to choose in which order the coordinates are read off the dice, so that each roll (other than doubles) gives two possible placements. If an occupied grid point is selected, points are scored according to the number of adjacent grid points contiguously occupied by stones of the owning player. The game is won by the player first player to reach a pre-determined total score. (The rules suggest 177, but this can lead to extremely long games...)

The game was originally published by Gamescience/Renwal. It was re-released by Das Spiel as Saxum, with some significant rules changes.

20441.name: Battleground World War II
boardgameexpansion: SkirmishElite: Screaming Eagles at Hamburger Hill
20441.description:
A comprehensive, well-presented set of skirmish rules for WWII, resolving action at the individual soldier and vehicle crew member level. The designers' intent is to provide fast-playing rules which capture the spirit of ground combat.
Units of both sides move in random order (determined by playing of cards), with each person able to perform two Actions per turn. Morale rules allow for fanatics, cowards and heroes, and Gut Checks are required before characters can perform highly risky acts. Rules cover artillery, engineers, armored and infantry combat.
A generic squad organization is provided, and generic hit locations for tanks and halftracks. Seven scenarios are designed to allow players to gradually learn the rules. Later supplements added new unit types, nationalities, and scenarios.
The rules are written to use Easy Eight's 28mm miniature line, but conversion charts are included for playing with 20mm and 15mm figures.

20442.name: Cluesome
20442.description: Cluesome - This game was an invention of the California NPL group, but traveling members and conventions have spread it to other parts. It requires a moderately large group of people -- 7 or 8 is barely enough to keep it interesting, 10 is good, and I have seen it played with about 15 players. The object of the game is to try to give clues for words such that some of the other people will guess the answer, but not more than half. Each player writes 5 words or phrases to be clued on individual note cards, along with his name on each card, and passes them face down to the player on his left. Each player draws one card (without looking) from the ones he is passed, then passes the rest of the cards on. Each player will end up with 5 cards from the 5 players to his right. Each player, in turn, becomes the cluer. The cluer chooses one of his cards, announces whose card it is, and gives a clue. The clue can be anything at all, as long or short as the cluer wants, even using part of the answer or clues that are wrong (like "the capital of New York" as a clue for New York City). The one limitation is that the cluer can't give a clue that turns the game into a multiple-choice guess among a few choices, such as "a planet" for Saturn or "a capital in New England" for Providence. After the clue is given, each player (other than the cluer and the submitter) has a short time to write down an answer, and then everybody in turn calls out what they have written down. If nobody gets it right, the cluer has to give another clue. The cluer loses one point for each clue he gives. If anybody guesses it, the cluer tells the correct answer and each of those people score a point. If exactly one person guesses correctly, this is called a "Cluesome" and the cluer gets 3 bonus points. If fewer than half the people guess correctly, then the cluer is done and the next player becomes cluer. If too many people guess correctly, the cluer has failed and must pick another word to clue, and thus lose more points for giving more clues.

20444.name: Pari-Manie
boardgamepublisher: Les Entreprises Aubé et Khacho inc.
20444.description:
Pari-Manie is basically a gambling game in which you want to become the richest player and ruin every other gambler aroud the table. Simple dice rolling is used to move along a board filled up with mini-games opportunities. Games such as: Poker, Horse racing, Black Jack, dices, Lucky 7...

Every game is played (solitaire) against a designated dealer, The only time you will be able to play against your adversaries is when you venture toward the middle of the board (instead of moving around the board). Then if you happen to stop on the middle space, called "Pari-manie", the fun begins. You will challenge an opponent to play a mini-game with you, the wager will be the total amount ($$$) of the poorest player (of the 2 playing). The player that was selected decides what game will be played from:

Poker
Black Jack
Dices
or a simple "cut a card from the deck".




If the poorest of the 2 players loses, he is eliminated (losing his whole wager). If he wins, he gets to double his money (courtesy of the loser).

Game contents:




style="text-align:right;"|1×

Board



style="text-align:right;"|1×

Plastic tray with money bills



style="text-align:right;"|1×

Traditional 52-card deck



style="text-align:right;"|10×

Horse racing cards



style="text-align:right;"|12×

Fruit cards



style="text-align:right;"|3×

Color-sided dices



style="text-align:right;"|2×

6 sided dices



style="text-align:right;"|8×

Player pieces



style="text-align:right;"|5×

Control cards

20445.description:
Quest for the DragonLords is a world conquest game where cunning is required to best manage your forces comprising of fleets and armies. Your goal is to dispatch your opponents’ King or Queen! You start the game with a few powerful leaders such as Wizards and a King. A DragonLord commander allows a player to teleport and attack anywhere in the known world! The fear generated by a DragonLord with its weapon of destruction – Dragon fire, reduces the fighting effectiveness of enemy forces.

The adventure continues in the wastelands comprising of various places of commerce such as villages, shrines, witch dens, Dragon Lair, Teleportal and oracles. Here, quest parties may consult with witches to gain tools such as a DragonOrb to complete your quest or visit the Oracle who will enlighten adventurers with words of wisdom from the gods.

So what’s new?
The second edition of “Quest for the Dragonlords” has been re-designed with all new graphics and subtle changes to game play to deliver a much more intense gaming experience. The gameboard has been completely redesigned with lush graphics to bring the adventure element of the game to the forefront. Each player can hire heroes to help their quest parties overcome difficulties on the various quests.
The prophecy cards allow players to interact with each other during the adventure phase. The prophecy cards give clues to the players where powerful treasures may be found but they also allow players to provoke the various companions of the other players to betray their quest parties. There are 20 beautifully illustrated quest cards of drooling monsters and demons of darkness for your quest parties to overcome.
The manufacturing process has been improved from the first edition to provide highly detailed plastic miniature Orcs, Elves, Dwarves, Barbarians, Longships and DragonLords. Each civilization now has a completely unique set of spells available to their Wizards. Each player when in favour of the gods of power may gain mana. Mana is now required to cast spells and may be redeemed for powerful scroll cards that can greatly affect the outcome of battles.
Drawing on the legends of Norse mythology and the intense graphics provided in the second edition of “Quest for the DragonLords” – A Fantasy Game of Adventure and World Conquest provides a very rich atmosphere. If you are looking for a game to provide an evening of strategy and adventure for your favourite knights of the round table, Quest for the DragonLords will be a feast for your friends.

There is an expansion available, called Crystal of Power, which adds the Amazones and the Nekromants, for the 5th and 6th player. Also some colored Power crystals wait to dicover on your quests through the lands.
20445.name: Quest for the DragonLords (Second Edition)
boardgamepodcastepisode: OBG 006: Endgame

20448.name: Tumble Bug
20448.description:
ORIGINAL BOX: 22 ½” x 6” x 3 ½”

“The unpredictable…
TUMBLEBUG
sensational race”

The tumblebugs are individually colored, small capsule-shaped objects about 1” high with a small mobile lead weight inside. The game components, apart from the lead weights and scoreboard/instruction sheet, are composed entirely of plastic. The ‘gameboard’ consists of a gently meandering 4-laned track which is almost 2’ long. The track is raised at one end by a 5” high stand. Above the stand is a starting gate which holds the tumblebugs prior to release. A finishing gate located at the other end of the track is designed to shut as the first tumblebug passes, preventing the remaining ones from reaching the finish. The edges of the interior lanes are incomplete, allowing the tumblebugs to change lanes randomly.

Before the tumblebugs are released, each player tries to predict which color will reach the finishing gate first. The first player to guess five results correctly is the winner.

(N.B. game was re-released in the early 1970s in a smaller box with the distinctive string handle favored by Schaper during this phase of their history. The track came in pieces and required assembly).

20449.name: Bible Mystery Events:  The Case of the Missing Professor
20449.description:
Strange things are afoot in the small Appalachian town of Wallar Hollar. Recently the great Professor Davidson was killed in a prison riot. And now his body has gone missing. On top of this a strange man named Jesse Coleman has appeared in Wallar Hollar asking everyone uncomfortable and probing questions about these unusual events . . . Welcome to The Case of the Missing Professor.

In this interactive murder mystery event, 5 to 25 players each take on the role of a unique character in this quaint little mountain town as they try to discover what happened to Professor Davidson's body and who this Jesse Coleman fellow really is.

20450.name: Flint & Steel
20450.description:
(from publisher:)

Flint & Steel Miniatures Rules for the American Revolution & Age of Reason

Flint & Steel continues the standard of excellence in wargaming established by Clash of Arms. More than an outstanding set of rules, Flint & Steel brings together in one source a wealth of information for this exciting period of warfare. No need to have miniature figures in order to use and enjoy these rules. You can easily get started right away by making your own units from templates provided inside.

Special Features:
For 5mm, 15mm, 20mm, 25mm, and 30 mm figures
Comprehensive rules that play quickly
Ratings and details for almost 700 individual American, British, German, French, and Indian units from the American Revolution
Unique, simple command and control system
Ratings on over 500 different types of units for 26 different armies from 1740-1789
Performance data on 50+ different artillery types
Recreates battles in North America, Europe, and the Far East
Ratings and details on over 300 leaders of the American Revolution
Optional rules to fully recreate a wide variety of maneuver battles
Introductory scenarios from the American Revolution and Seven Years War
Includes unique scenario generator
140 die cut counters to mark play progress

Contents:
Size: 40 page soft bound rules book with full color cover plus a 64 page unit and weapon data book.
Examples of Play: Included.
Diagrams and Illustrations: Included.
Complexity: Moderate, figure templates allow play without miniatures.
Players: Two or more recommended while solitaire suitability is excellent.
Author: Richard J. Kane.

20451.name: Bratz Twister
20451.description: Exactly the same as Twister, but it has pictures of the Bratz toys and costs $2 more. Also known as "5th Horseman of the Apocalypse"

20453.name: Teddy Bear Look and Find Lotto
20453.description:
The "Teddy Bear" Look and Find Lotto game has four busy picture boards of teddies having fun, and the object is for each player to be the first to collect all ten picture cards that correspond to his picture board.

Components: 4 picture boards, 40 picture cards.

To play:
1. Each player takes one of the four picture boards. The 40 cards are shuffled and placed in a central pile face-down.
2. The first player takes the top card, and tries to describe the picture in as much detail as possible.
3. If a player finds the describe card on his board, he takes the card and places it on one of the ten squares around his picture board.
4. The game continues until one player has filled all ten squares on his picture board.

20455.name: Grasshoppers
20455.description:
Similar to the tiddledy-winks styled Frog Game [19456], Grasshoppers is a light dexterity game produced by Early Learning Centre for young children age 3 and up.

The game is played with small brightly coloured plastic grasshoppers, which are flipped vertically with your index finger into a circular scoring container. The object of the game is to flip your grasshoppers into the container, gaining bonus points if the grasshopper lands in the small circular compartment in the middle of the container. There are four colours of grasshoppers: red, yellow, green, and blue.

20456.description:
From book:

Welcome to the latest chapter in the VBAM Series: the Victory by Any Means: Fire As She Bears! Edition. In these source materials we explore the exciting world of naval combat at the height of the Age of Sail. It is a time when England’s “Wooden Walls” kept her commerce alive and the armies of Napoleon at bay. A time when tall, proud warships prowled the vast waterways of the world, and such ships as the U.S.S. Constitution were to earn their place as legend.

For those of you who are new to either Victory by Any Means or Starboard Tack Press products, welcome! This game is modeled after the popular Victory by Any Means: Campaign Guide, and has been carefully developed and tested to fit the unique feel of the Age of Sail. By using the Origins Award (2005 Vanguard) winning Fire As She Bears! game as our tactical system, we can finally give gamers a fluid product that lets you worry about important decisions and planning of the Admiralty. For this latest source, the VBAM team has worked with Phil C. Fry, the author of the popular Napoleonic tactical naval game Fire As She Bears! to bring you a supplement which enables you to fight the war at sea as the Admiralty of a nation, subject to the whims of the crown and to generate gritty battles where sailing skills and cunning decide the fate of the battle.

This is a stand alone book that requires no other VBAM Games products to play, although Starboard Tack Press’ Fire As She Bears! Second Edition is highly recommended for a complete Age of Sail experience.
20456.name: Victory By Any Means: Fire As She Bears Edition
boardgamefamily: Victory By Any Means Campaign Series

20457.name: Italy
20457.description:
Italy is a great variation of Axis & Allies: Europe. It changes setup, and some rules (only Italian language at the moment).

Expands:

Axis & Allies: Europe




Home Page: http://giocolab.135.it

NB: Rules are given in English in the review:

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/2683755#2683755

20460.name: Little Polar Bear Card Game
20460.description:
Match four cards by their colored picture symbols. Arrange the sets of cards to create a delightful picture from hans de Beer's popular Little Polar Bear books. Make the most sets and you win the game.

Little Polar Bear Card Game is a variation on Go Fish, and is geared towards young children ages 4 and up. With no reading or number skills required, this two-part game will help reinforce basic counting, color identification, memory, and puzzle-solving skills.

Components: 32 full-color cards, instructions, plastic draw-pile tray.

20461.name: Guesstures: Bible Edition
20461.description:
Guesstures®, Hasbro's family fovorite of split second characters now comes in a fun-filled BIBLE EDITION from Cactus Game Design, Inc.

QUICK! You only have few short seconds per word! Your four words this round are “Baptize,” “Cross,” “Moses” and “Lamb”. It looks easy, but it’s not. As soon as your team guesses the word on the card – grab it before it gets swallowed by the card-hungry Mimer-Timer™. Then hurry on to the next card!

The harder the word, the more points it’s worth.
Grab the most points to win!

20462.name: Zebra Zucht
20462.description:
Zebrazucht.

Northern Germany

The year is 2119. Global warming has pushed northern Europe’s yearly average temperature to 27.7 C. The sale and breeding of exotic animals is one of the fastest growing businesses in the world. Breeding in captivity has become a necessity for the survival of most of the species existing 30 degrees longitude north and south of the equator. This massive area is so hot and dry that the remaining animals are simply fighting for survival and have no energy left for breeding. A massive movement to save these animals from extinction and the preservation of a living gene pool for genetic engineering has become the focus of many different organizations around the world.

Schleswig Holstein is the world leader in the art of genetically engineering exotic animals. They are highlighting and creating new traits in animals. Zebrazucht is a clinical experiment by two of the leading companies in the field of Genetics. One company genetically stripped male Zebras of most white coloration. The second company was able to genetically create female Zebras to be void of most of their black pigmentation. This six-year-old project is now in its final stages and the animals are being brought together for the first time in the height of mating season. A special breeding facility was created to accommodate the project.

Players take on the role of scientists from both companies trying to bring as many pairs together as possible. The calculated end result should produce offspring Zebras that revert back to a more brilliantly stripped black and white color. If things go wrong the offspring might be hard to distinguish if placed amongst Holstein cows.

In this two-player game players move two workers towards each other and place a fence of their colour in that space.
Once a player has four fences of his color surrounding a corral that player places his Zebra in the space.The person opening the most corrals to unite black & white Zebras wins.

20463.name: Dog Pound
20463.description:
Dog Pound is a fast condition-recognition game similar to Slamwich, Twitch and Bongo. The cards are cut to resemble dog biscuits, and contain matching pairs of dogs and owners who bear an uncanny resemblance to each other. Whenever a pair appears on the card pile, the first person to slap the pile wins all of the cards.

There are also three special action cards that add a twist to the pattern recognition required in the game. The fire hydrant card costs you an extra card, which is added to the pile. The dog catcher card allows you to pick up the pile, but you have to leave the dog catcher behind. And finally, the dog biscuit card is a sort of wild card, and whoever slaps the pile first with a dog biscuit on it wins the pile.

The player who collects all of the cards in the deck wins.

Contents:

20 Dog Cards
20 Dog Owner Cards
2 Fire Hydrant Cards
2 Dog Catcher Cards
4 Dog Biscuit Cards
Rules on the box

20464.name: The Wind in the Willows
20464.description:
The Wind in the Willows game is a simple roll and move game for up to four players. The game was published by Reader's Digest using artwork and characters from the TVC London production of The Wind in the Willows for Carlton TV.

Players take it in turns to roll the dice and move their character (Mole, Ratty, Mr Toad or Badger) the number shown. Throughout the game players will land on spaces that will slow down or speed up the progress to the celebration party at Toad Hall. The instructions on the various squares must be followed when they are landed on.

The first player to land on the Finish at Square 49 with an exact throw on the dice is the winner.

20465.name: The Bill
20465.description:
THE BILL - A game to beat all others is described as "an exciting chase game where you start as a humble Bobby onthe Beat and compete with the other players to become Superintendent."

The game is loosely based on the Thames Television (UK) police series, but is different from the other game on the database of the same name which is also based on the same TV series.

Players take it in turns to roll a die and move their police car marker round the board. The square landed on will be of three types:

"Incident" - follow the instructions on the square.

"Hello, hello, hello" - draw a card from the appropriate deck. These are general knowledge questions on various criminal and legal subjects as well as general police procedures. Successfully answering of the question will allow for advancement or the avoidance of a penalty.

"In Court" - draw a from the appropriate deck. These will involve certain skills (observation, memory, impersonation etc.) and will usually result in moving forwards, backwards or missing a turn.

At various places on the board there is the opportunity for promotion (and also demotion). The winner is the first person to do their time by passing the golden handcuffs square on the inner ring twice, to become the all powerful Superintendent.

20466.description: This is a two player card game simulating the battle of Berlin (4/3/1945 – 5/2/1945). Players are Russian Generals competing to be the first to capture Berlin. One player is Marshal Georgi Zhukov (First Belorussian Front). The other player is Marshal Ivan Koniev (First Ukranian Front). The game is free to print and play from the Ludi Popina web site.
20466.name: Battle of Berlin

20467.name: Conquest
20467.description:
Conquest is the orginal version of the 1970s game of the same name. Donald Benge wrote the game and his company, The Quest Game Company, publishes a quarterly "magazine" to support CONQUEST and other games by the company. There are two versions of the game: a version designed exclusively for two players and a four-player version. The 1986 versions comes with manufactured components of a much higher quality than previous editions including:

Four high quality color map boards that fit together "puzzle" style, two bags of colored 3-D playing pieces representing ancients-era military units, a four-page rulebook (two double-sided pages), and an attractive storage box.

Set in a time of ancient warfare, Conquest is a strategy game that emphasizes strategic movement, sort of like an upgraded version of Chess. Players control different combinations of foot troops, cavalry, chariots, elephants and ships to try to capture their opponents' fortifications and/or occupy the "quest" locations. There are several scenarios included in the short rule book (Really a booklet!) and players are encouraged to design their own.

Though confusing in name, Conquest is a re-implementation of this game with the same name but with play up to four players.

20468.name: Tumblin Dice Timberrr
20468.description:
Tumblin Dice Timberrr (that's how the name is really spelled!) is a tower building game like Jenga, but with 48 brightly coloured wooden rectangular bricks, and a large colored die. The wooden bricks are built into a tower with 16 layers of three.
Object: Roll the die to see what colour block to draw from the tower (with one hand) and restack on top. Skip a turn if you roll a "Pass" on the die.
Winner: The last player to stack a brick without the Tumblin Dice Towerrr falling wins the game.
Components: Includes 48 wooden bricks, a large die, and a Safe Stacker to make building the tower easier.

20469.name: Nebula Raiders
20469.description: This low-complexity science fiction simulation game was distributed online in printable electronic format. Players move their spacecraft around on a hex grid representing an unstable region of space. Their objective is to collect a full cargo load of valuable "pseudo plasma" and return home. This is complicated by two factors: everyone is armed with blasters, and the turbulent nebula causes random movement and damage to ships. In addition to using counters to represent ships and potential hotspots on the mapboard, each player also has a status card where additional counters track ship system condition and repair status. Optional rules are included for sensor probes, ship enhancement, team play and a few other add-ons.

20470.description:
Puck! is an ice hockey simulation game. Each player receives a hand of nine cards showing either a player position (Defenseman, Wing, Thug, or Center) or an action (such as Hook, Line Change, Breakaway or Great Save) as well as a value. Generally, players have higher values, but lack the special abilities given by action cards.
To begin play, each player simultaneously plays reveals one card for the faceoff. After seeing the opponent's play, each person chooses two other cards to add to their play. Whichever players set of 3 cards has the highest total value has the advantage and may take a shot. A card from the draw pile is flipped over in order to decide if the shot was on goal and what the target number for success will be, then one more card is flipped over. If the value of the second card, plus any modifiers from players cards such as Breakaway, or by having a much higher three card value than your opponent exceeds the target number, a goal has been scored. If there is no goal, players check for penalties (if a Hook was played) or fights (if each team played a Thug), both of which are resolved by reducing the hand size of one of the players.
Play continues with the cards in hand, even if one side is unable to play 3 cards from injury or penalties. If at the start of a round, a player has no cards, they draw a new hand of nine (a Line Change). Line Changes also occur after goals (for both teams) or by playing a Line Change card during a round.
Once the deck is exhausted and not enough cards are left to complete a round, the period ends. The player with the most goals after three periods wins.
20470.name: Puck!

20471.name: Rabbit Guessing
20471.description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin (similar to an Altoids tin) and contain small wooden pieces.

Place the carrot patch in the center of the playing area and the two rabbits (one belonging to each player) equidistant from the carrot patch (approximately 12 inches).

Players take turns. On your turn, secretly distribute the three carrots between your hands. The other player then selects one hand without knowing how many carrots are in each of your hands. If that player selects a hand that has carrots in it, they line up the carrots lengthwise in front of their rabbit and in the direction of the carrot patch. They then move their rabbit to just in front of the last carrot (closest to the patch).

First player to the carrot patch wins.

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!>

20472.description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin (similar to an Altoids tin) and contain small wooden pieces.

The tin lid is placed on the ball (can be done in two ways - one making the game more challenging than the other). Place the mouse in the center of the lid. Each player gets 6 wedges of cheese. Players take turns pushing a cheese wedge onto the lid. It must be completely on the lid and no wedge can be placed on top of another. If you cause any wedges to fall off, you must take them. If the lid slips off the ball, you must take all the pieces that had been on the lid, reset the tin lid with mouse and then push a wedge on. Whoever is left without cheese first wins.

<!-- Entry audited by (nsolitander) (13-08-2009) --!>
20472.name: Mouse Acrobat

20473.name: Dog's Luck
20473.description:
One of Haba's Mini-Spiels that come in a small tin (similar to an Altoids tin) and contain small wooden pieces.

Components: 4 dogs in 4 colors (one for each player), 5 bones, 1 die (sides are 1/2/2/3/doghouse/doghouse) and game tin with the lid half open (doghouse).

Place the doghouse in the center of the playing area and place the 5 bones in it. The players' dogs begin next to the doghouse on the long side to the left of the doghouse opening (door).

Players take turns. On your turn, roll the die. If the doghouse is rolled, turn the doghouse one quarter turn in any direction. If you roll a number, move that many 'spaces' in a clockwise direction around the doghouse, each 'space' being one side of the doghouse. If you can land inside the doghouse with an exact roll (jumping in from the short side with the door), you take a bone from the doghouse. If you are in the doghouse and you roll a doghouse, you cannot leave it on that turn.

First player to collect 2 bones wins.

Ages 5-99

20475.description:
Avanti Savoia is a supplement for Flames of War, the World War II miniatures game. It provides the organization and equipment for the Italian Armored and Infantry Forces.

There are complete organization and equipment lists for Carri, Bersaglieri, Fucilieri, Motociclisti and Paracadutisti Companies in North Africa, Sicily and Italy. Additional rules and variants include German Allies, variants for ARMIR (Italian Army in Russia), variants for the 6th Army in Italy. There is also the history of the 132nd 'Ram' Armored Division.

Tactics articles, painting guide, and rules for warriors are also included.
20475.name: Avanti Savoia: Intelligence Handbook on Italian Armoured and Infantry Forces
boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

20476.description:
A children's game based on the characters from New Zealand author Lynley Dodds' award-winning Hairy Maclary series of children's books.

Hairy Maclary from Donaldson's Dairy and his friends Hercules Morse, Bottomley Potts and Muffin McLay, are out for a walk, and must return to Donaldson's Dairy without getting caught by Scarface Claw, the toughest Tom in town.

Object of the game - The winner is the first dog to complete its walk from its starting position on the board - around the playground, the zoo, the beach and the park to reach Donaldson's Dairy, avoiding Scarface Claw.
20476.name: Hairy Maclary Game

20477.description:
'FireFights!' scenarios are small, intense scenarios compatible with the ASL game system or any other tactical level wargame. All aspects of the game system are covered - with infantry, armor and artillery set in a variety of terrain and theatres.
Variety and re-playability are key components of FireFight Packs. Each scenario has a variable Order of Battle and most have variable entry turns and reinforcements. The reinforcements, when received, are historically accurate as to equipment available to that particular unit while it was in combat. Fog of war is also enhanced through set up and Scenario Variables. As a bonus each FireFight scenario comes with its own historically based 8 1/2 by 11 inch map for playing.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
20477.name: Heat of Battle:  FireFights!

20478.description: Each player throws the Dice, the highest scorer starts first. The person who starts to play shakes the Dice and moves his marble the number of cups shown on the Dice. The other players do the same in turn. Should one player land on the cup already occupied, that player must go back to the beginning and start again. The winner is the first person to occupy the centre cup by throwing the right number on the Dice. Sould the number be too great, he counts towards the middle and then counts backwards from the middle the extra number of cups.
boardgameversion: House of Marbles White Box Edition
20478.name: Snail

20479.name: Tim and Tam
20479.description:
A lovely amusing children & family game for 2-8 players. Tim Tomato and Tam Paprika take you to the market to sell fruits and vegetables. Who gets paid most for the fruit and vegetable cards wins!

Players take turns moving around the board collecting fruits and vegetables. Once all the fruit and vegetable cards have been collected, one of the players randomly selects one of the three market value cards. Using the chosen card, the players add up their points. Whoever has the most points wins.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/timtam.htm
